alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake and Bear River Valley; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 4:17PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Cache and northwestern Rich Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 415 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Garden, or 10 miles southwest of Laketown, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Laketown, Garden City, Garden, Bear Lake, Meadowville, Pickelville and Lakota. This storm will be capable of producing strong gusty winds on Bear Lake. This will lead to a sudden increase in waves and very choppy waters which will result in hazardous boating conditions. Boaters are urged to seek safe harbor if possible. This includes the following highways... US Route 89 between mile markers 489 and 502. Utah Route 30 between mile markers 110 and 124. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bear Lake and Bear River Valley; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North
